intro: Senecio gaffatensis, commonly known as the Gaffatensis groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months, and its leaves are usually narrow and hairy. Senecio gaffatensis is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it thrives in well-drained conditions.
